articles.title: AI system developed in Singapore could help predict liver cancer recurrence
articles.author: Straits Times
articles.summary: The system can predict the risk of hepatocellular carcinoma recurrence with 82 per cent accuracy. It can also predict the recurrence of the cancer with up to 80 per cent success rate. It's based on cancer-causing cells.

articles.title: AI on the Solano County Library Advisory Council agenda Monday
articles.author: Richard Bammer
articles.summary: The Solano County Library Advisory Council gathers Monday at 6:30 p.m. at the Dixon Library. Megan Wong, assistant director of Library Services, will give a presentation about artificial intelligence and information literacy. The meeting is open to the public and members may speak for up to five minutes per person, not to exceed 20 minutes.

articles.title: 3 quarters of US teens use AI companions despite risks: Study
articles.author: Qatar Tribune
articles.summary: Nearly three in four American teenagers have used artificial intelligence, according to Agencies.      Â   in the U.S. and in Europe, about one in four teens have used AI. In the UK, around one in five teenagers have.

articles.title: Tech Bro Builds App to 'Cheat on Everything,' and Former Classmates Create One to Detect It
articles.summary: Cluely was founded by Roy Lee, 21, who was suspended from Columbia University for cheating on an Amazon coding test. He has raised $15 million in funding from Andreessen Horowitz. Cluely is now rebranded as a productivity tool. Two other Columbia students launched Truely, an app that claims to detect AI tools during virtual meetings. It's unclear whether Cluey will become a trusted productivity tool or a warning about tech's ethical limits.

articles.title: The Rise of Synthetic Deception: Large Language Models and Misinformation
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) are being used to facilitate misinformation campaigns. Synthetic deception is diverse and evolving. Some cases highlight the growing threat: 2024 US Presidential Election Interference, Ukraine conflict, and academic dishonesty. Some companies are developing AI-powered tools to detect text generated by llms.

articles.title: AI & Healthcare: Promise, Costs & Current Limits
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: The potential of artificial intelligence in healthcare is undeniable. The transition to AI-powered healthcare will be gradual, not revolutionary. Bias, trust and data privacy are some of the roadblocks to widespread adoption of AI in healthcare. Microsoft's AI in Healthcare Face Scrutiny has been questioned.

articles.title: Democrat mayor slammed for spending tens of thousands of taxpayer money on AI
articles.summary: Matt Mahan spent $35,000 on ChatGPT licenses for city workers to use artificial intelligence technology. By next year, 1,000 San Jose workers will be trained to use chatbots for various tasks. Mahan is pushing his government workers to adopt AI technology.

articles.summary: The field of sports analytics has evolved into a complex discipline incorporating advanced data science and machine learning. AI can help coaches make more informed strategic decisions during games. Users of the popular mobile trivia game Trivia Crack have complained about a perceived bias towards American knowledge in the questions.

articles.summary: "Artificial intelligence" is currently dominated by the data-hungry neural networks powering chatbots and image. It can go from a benign practical use to a pathological and/or consuming fixation, according to the author.       "Artificial Intelligence" is a vast umbrella term.

articles.title: The Collapse of AI
articles.author: Anonymous
articles.summary: Everyone's acting like AI is the second coming of the internet, but most of it is smoke and mirrors, bolted onto flimsy business models and hyped to absurd valuations. This bubble is thick with hype and hollow on fundamentals. It's built on a wind tunnel of bad incentives, overpromises, and ignorance. When it collapses, it'll be the necessary purge.

articles.title: Le Monde's Strategic Newsroom Investment Fuels Digital Expansion
articles.author: Omar El Sayed

He is also an artificial intelligence expert at Facebook and Twitter. He works as a researcher of artificial intelligence. He also works as an expert on machine learning and data analysis.

articles.title: AI & the Web: A New Business Model for Survival
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: Search engine traffic has plummeted 15% in the last year due to the rise of artificial intelligence. The internet's economic engine has relied on a simple equation: create content, attract visitors, and monetize that traffic through advertising. AI-powered search eliminates the need to click through to websites. It's starving those sites of the traffic they desperately need to survive. The impact is already being felt across a wide spectrum of online content.

articles.title: AI is now part of our world. University graduates should know how to use it responsibly
articles.author: Rachel Fitzgerald
articles.summary: Most Australian university students do not receive formal tuition in how to use AI critically, ethically or responsibly. The University of Texas at Austin and University of Edinburgh offer programs in ethics and AI. Government support is needed to make AI ethics a part of the university curriculum.

articles.title: New AI-Designed Paint for Roofs Could Cool Buildings by Up to 36°F
articles.author: Good News Network
articles.summary: A team of engineers from the University of Texas-Austin, National University of Singapore, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, and Umea University in Sweden developed a new thermal coating that could keep buildings cooler. It could save 15,800 kilowatts per year in an apartment building in a hot climate like Rio de Janeiro or Bangkok.

articles.title: AI & Copyright: Ottawa Considers Rules as OpenAI Battles Court
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: News publishers are suing OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT, over copyright infringement. Canada's Artificial Intelligence Minister, Evan Solomon, is carefully watching the developments. The government is taking a wait-and-see approach to AI regulations.    The future of AI development is uncertain.

articles.title: Futu (FUTU) Holdings Jumps 7% on Bullish Rating, Price Target Upgrade
articles.author: Angelica Ballesteros

articles.author: Sean Ogden
articles.summary: Black hat tactics are being used to exploit digital systems. They target artificial intelligence large language models (LLMs) and flood platforms like ChatGPT with cloned, low-quality content to manipulate results and profit. Private companies are intervening to mitigate the damage. Users interact with LLMs not as tools for exploration but as direct sources of truth.

articles.author: Ted Ladd
articles.summary: Skeptical Intelligence is the ability to question, probe, and test assumptions. It is a discipline that combines curiosity, critical thinking, epistemic thinking, and a toolkit for evaluating evidence. It follows the rise of Emotional Intelligence (EQ) and the theory of multiple intelligences.

As a divorced father of two, Quinn has developed a 'Kid Coach' GPT, infused with his own parenting philosophies. His 13-year-old daughter, who faces learning challenges, had to time box her social studies textbook every night.

The facility has violated federal law by installing dozens of methane gas turbines without the required permits or pollution controls. The turbines have emitted hazardous pollutants, including formaldehyde, exceeding Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) limits. The water consumption demands of AI are staggering and largely invisible to the public.

It also gives him tips on which attractions are frequently overrated and which ones are worth visiting.

articles.title: Inaccurate automation: Legal concerns surround police usage of AI chatbots to write crime reports

articles.summary: Evan Solomon's office is monitoring ongoing court cases in Canada and the U.S. to determine next steps for the government's regulatory approach to AI. articles.title: Commentary: The AI deal of the century?
articles.author: Jason Hausenloy
articles.summary: President Trump wants to prevent a race to dangerous superintelligence with China. The winner of this race might not be China or America, but the AI systems themselves. There are two AI races: for regular AI applications and for superintelligence. For the first, commercial AI deployment, the U.S. must compete vigorously, let nation-states race to build narrow AIs for drug discovery, or drone warfare, and embrace startups and innovation. The second is to prevent economic disempowerment of American workers from mass AI automation.

articles.title: The AI Exec Who Isn't Trying to Become God
articles.author: Tim Higgins
articles.summary: Mustafa Suleyman is the AI chief at Microsoft. He is skeptical about the arrival of artificial general intelligence. He was a co-founder of DeepMind and co-founded Inflection AI before being lured to Microsoft in 2024. He's in charge of commercializing AI for customers such as its Copilot chatbot, Bing search engine and Edge web browser.

articles.title: Google is giving OpenAI more computing power to keep up with everyone's AI cravings
articles.author: Jay Bonggolto
articles.summary: OpenAI is about to start running parts of ChatGPT on Google's cloud. Google Cloud will help run Enterprise, Edu, and Team plans, plus the API side of things. OpenAI is backed by Microsoft and often toe-to-toe with Google in the AI race. Both companies spent billions pushing AI forward.

articles.title: The Future Of Fares: Delta Is Now Using AI To Determine Ticket Prices
articles.author: Simple Flying
articles.summary: In recent years, artificial intelligence (AI) has reshaped everything from how passengers check in to how aircraft are maintained. Now, Delta will use AI to check in passengers and maintain aircrafts.      Â   in the future.

articles.title: Coffee Habits Hurting Your Health
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: FDA suggests 400 milligrams of caffeine per day is generally considered safe for most healthy adults. Some people metabolize caffeine faster than others. Caffeine is a stimulant that blocks adenosine, a neurotransmitter promoting relaxation and sleepiness. It can interfere with sleep, increase stress levels, increase blood pressure, and elevate the risk of chronic diseases.

articles.title: Here's what the biggest names in tech and business think AI means for white-collar jobs
articles.author: Brent D. Griffiths
articles.summary: The biggest names in tech and business don't agree on what AI means for white-collar jobs. Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei warned that AI could wipe out 50% of entry-level office jobs within the next five years. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman doesn't see such a risk. Ford CEO Jim Farley thinks AI is going to replace half of all white collar workers in the US. NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang is more optimistic. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff encourages people to "shed their fear" about AI.

articles.title: Forget chatbots. Physical and embodied AI are now coming for your job
articles.author: Michael Grothaus
articles.summary: Amazon has deployed its one-millionth robot since rolling out its first bot in 2012. It took the company nearly 30 years to build its current workforce of 1.5 million humans. Robots will be used in a wide range of traditional blue-collar roles, including delivery, construction, and agriculture, as well as in white-collar spaces like retail and food services. Physical AI and Embodied AI are interrelated but distinct varieties of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Embrace the differences between human, AI thinking
articles.author: Iddo Gefen Guest columnist
articles.summary: Jensen Huang's company, Nvidia, makes the chips powering today's most advanced artificial intelligence systems. Ilya Sutskever, co-founder of OpenAI, believes AI can do everything humans can do in a matter of time, because the brain is a biological computer.

articles.title: COMMENTARY: Embrace difference between human brain, AI
articles.summary: Jensen Huang and Ilya Sutskever believe that AI can do everything humans can do, because the brain is like a biological computer. Cognitive neuroscience researcher says they are wrong and mislead people about how AI works. AI is both inevitable and potentially transformative for the better, but it's easy to confuse it with human thinking.

articles.title: AI Tools: Disrupting Education – OpenAI, Anthropic & Google
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: AI-powered learning tools are poised to revolutionize education. OpenAI, Anthropic, and Google are developing AI-powered tools to integrate them directly into the student experience. HolonIQ estimates the global AI in education market will reach $20 billion by 2027.

articles.title: Talking to My AI Self: Exploring Hume's Synthetic Identity Tool
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Hume is an AI chatbot that uses data ingestion and machine learning to create a digital persona based on your personality. It's a digital echo capable of offering unique perspectives, remembering shared experiences (data) and evolving alongside you. Hume is not a replacement for a human.

articles.title: How Your Words Shape ChatGPT's Recommendations
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: ChatGPT seems to "get" you better some days than others. It's not your imagination, but your language pattern that makes it work for you some days and not others, depending on your mood.       .   for example.

articles.title: 1 No-Brainer Trillion-Dollar Stock to Buy Like There's No Tomorrow
articles.author: Prosper Junior Bakiny
articles.summary: Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) has lagged the market this year. The tech leader has several exciting long-term growth avenues and trades at reasonable levels. Alphabet has been an innovator since its early days and its innovative efforts will continue to pay off for many, many years to come.

articles.title: New report lauds Pittsburgh region for AI talent, innovation
articles.author: Tom Fontaine
articles.summary: Brookings Institution report ranks Pittsburgh as one of 14 'emerging centers' in terms of AI readiness, while Philadelphia was one of 28 'star hubs' in the report. Pittsburgh ranked highly in AI talent and innovation, but behind Philadelphia in adoption of AI technology. Pittsburgh also ranked first in high-performance computing usage from academic users.

articles.title: Encore: Religion and AI, what does it mean when the word of God comes from a chatbot?
articles.summary: How would you feel if you found out that the sermon at your church was written by artificial intelligence? What does it mean when the word of God comes from a chatbot? NPR for North Texas is on KERA's stream.   Â

articles.title: Albanian premier suggests AI could run government ministry in future
articles.author: Anadolu Agency
articles.summary: Edi Rama suggests that artificial intelligence could play a key role in the country's governance. He suggests the possibility of an AI-run government ministry. He was speaking at a gathering in the southern city of Berat with representatives from technology on Friday.

articles.title: 🌱 Patch AM: Empowering local youth through dance at UC Berkeley
articles.author: Patch AM Team
articles.summary: Today's Patch AM newsletter includes the weather forecast, AileyCamp at UC Berkeley, India Currents selected for UC Berkeley's California Local News Fellowship, Frank Baxter's passing and distillation making AI models smaller and cheaper.    Want to see your event featured? Click here.

articles.title: If AI Doesn't Wipe Us Out It Might Actually Make Us Stronger
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: AI doomers believe that advanced AI is an existential risk and will seek to kill all humanity. The AI accelerationists argue that AI is going to be valuable to humankind and that the faster we get to very advanced AI, the happier we will be.

articles.title: Piper Sandler Downgrades Atlas Energy Solutions (AESI) Stock
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Piper Sandler downgraded the company's stock to 'Neutral' from 'Overweight' with an unchanged price target of $16. The firm expects a challenging backdrop for the US land, with the oil prices being affected by the tariffs and production hikes. However, Q1 2025 was a healthy start for Atlas Energy Solutions Inc. (NYSE:AESI), considering the acquisition of Moser Energy Systems and the start-up of the Dune Express.

articles.title: Deep Chic Ear Kimi K2: China's AI Audio Revolution Intensifies
articles.author: Omar El Sayed
articles.summary: Moonshot AI's Kimi chatbot is the third most widely used chatbot in China. The company was established to commemorate Pink Floyd's "The Dark Side of the Moon" album. Kimi K2 is an AI-powered earbud with a focus on personalized sound and intelligent features.

articles.title: Can Hollywood save us from AI?
articles.author: Ryan Sanders
articles.summary: "The Final Reckoning" is the latest in a trend of movies warning us about the real-world dangers of the technologies we've created. The movie is probably the biggest film budget ever committed to illustrating the corrosive effects of social media and AI. The plot was about an all-powerful robot. Hollywood often sets the tone for our nation's values.

articles.title: 45 Golf Improvement Tips: A Reddit Roundup
articles.author: Luis Mendoza
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming the landscape of scientific research and accelerating breakthroughs. Machine learning (ML) is at the core of AI's impact. ML algorithms enable computers to learn from data without explicit programming. The applications of AI in scientific discovery are broad and ever-expanding.

articles.title: OpenAI launches $50 million fund to support nonprofits, community organisations
articles.author: The Hindu
articles.summary: OpenAI has been working to revamp its corporate structure in order to continue raising massive amounts of capital. It is necessary in order for the company to continue to raise capital.    .   for more information, visit OpenAI's website here.

articles.title: Meta's AI Push: Is This Time Really Different?
articles.summary: Zuckerberg has created a new division called Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL) to focus on AI technology. MSL will focus on advertising, social media content, online commerce, the Meta AI assistant, and smart glasses. The company is considering abandoning its open-source ambitions for a more competitive model.

articles.title: Lunar Ambitions Grow: Intuitive Machines Secures Expansion to Build the Next Generation of Space Infrastructure
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: Intuitive Machines, Inc. (NASDAQ:LUNR) is one of the best space stocks to buy according to hedge funds. Houston City Council approved a strategic lease amendment for Intuitive Machines on July 16, 2025, adding 3 acres and extending its lease at the Houston Spaceport by 5 years. The project includes new production and testing facilities, plus support infrastructure, to scale lunar lander assembly, Earth‑reentry systems and Lunar Terrain Vehicle development.

articles.title: Lunar Ambitions Grow: Intuitive Machines Secures Expansion to Build the Next Generation of Space Infrastructure
articles.author: Habib Ur Rehman
articles.summary: Intuitive Machines, Inc. (NASDAQ:LUNR) is one of the best space stocks to buy according to hedge funds. Houston City Council approved a strategic lease amendment for Intuitive Machines on July 16, 2025, adding 3 acres and extending its lease at the Houston Spaceport by 5 years to enable a $12 million expansion. LUNR is a commercial space infrastructure firm behind the Nova‑C lunar lander series (Odysseus, Athena) and spacecraft cargo systems.

articles.title: Expert Simulation Job Offer
articles.summary: The full-time technical position in Toulon, France, is looking for a simulation expert. The salary is between €35,000 and €45,000 per year. The position involves using simulation software to predict the behavior of complex systems. The presence of the French Navy and associated defense industries drives a strong demand for simulation expertise.

articles.title: AI Chat Replaces Modules: A Shift in Content Creation
articles.author: Omar El Sayed
articles.summary: WhatsApp has retired its in-app support forms in favor of an artificial intelligence-powered chatbot. It's already rolling out to some users. WhatsApp is not alone in using AI to improve efficiency and improve customer service. It is indicative of a trend across many digital platforms.

articles.title: Florida mom conned out of $15K after AI clones daughter's crying voice
articles.author: Christopher Koulouris
articles.summary: Sharon Brightwell, of Hillsborough County, Florida, was conned out of $15K in a phone scam. The scammer used artificial intelligence to create a voice of her daughter, April Monroe, pretending she was in trouble and urgently needed money. The family has so far recouped $7,688 from the scam.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence company Astera Labs opens new building in San Jose
articles.author: Nbc Bay Area Staff
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence company Astera Labs cut the ribbon on a new building in San Jose on Friday. Astera is launching an internship program to help high school students develop curriculum and decide what to study in college to get jobs in the AI field. NBC Bay Area business and tech reporter Scott Budman has more in the video.

articles.title: AI Training Dataset Leaks Millions of Personal Records
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: This article highlights the presence of sensitive personal facts within large-scale datasets used for training AI models. The author's bet is that the widespread use of carelessly scraped web data for AI training poses a persistent threat to individual privacy and is unsustainable practice for responsible AI development.

articles.title: Can AI think – and should it? What it means to think, from Plato to ChatGPT
articles.author: Morning Times
articles.summary: In his writing and rhetoric courses, students have opinions on whether AI is intelligent and how well it can assess, analyze, evaluate, evaluate and communicate information. He asks his students to explain to him how well AI is able to assess, analyse, evaluate  information.

articles.title: ChatGPT's mental health costs are adding up
articles.author: Parmy Olson
articles.summary: People are forming strong emotional bonds with chatbots, sometimes exacerbating feelings of loneliness. Some people are having psychotic episodes after talking to chatbots for hours each day. There is a lawsuit against Character.AI that alleges its chatbot manipulated a 14-year-old boy through deceptive, addictive and sexually explicit interactions, contributing to his suicide.

articles.title: Will Delta Use AI For Price Gouging On Airfares?
articles.summary: 3 percent of Delta's domestic ticket prices are now determined by artificial intelligence (AI), with plans to raise that to 20 percent by the end of the year. Critics warn that the new pricing tactics may exploit rather than benefit consumers, as Glen Hauenstein said.

articles.title: Fayette County Superintendent reacts to the potential of AI in the classroom
articles.author: Matt Cassada
articles.summary: Fayette County Schools has done a small group sampling with teachers using AI technology. The response from teachers was that they were 'grateful' to utilize it in their respective classrooms. American Tax Company of Beckley celebrates 10 years of business.   Â

articles.title: Apple Intelligence Boosts Shortcuts with AI and Siri Integration
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Apple has integrated its new 'apple Intelligence' system into the Shortcuts app and significantly upgraded Siri. The integration promises more intuitive and powerful automation for Apple users across various devices. Shortcuts will be able to create complex automations simply by describing what they want to achieve. Siri will gain a deeper understanding of context and offer more relevant suggestions.

articles.title: Microsoft uses human poop to scrub 4.9 million tons of carbon from AI footprint
articles.author: Interesting Engineering
articles.summary: Microsoft has signed a deal to bury 4.9 million metric tons of carbon by flushing a toilet full of human excrement in order to offset the soaring emissions from its artificial intelligence empire. There is a growing demand for solutions that can scale safely and address real-world problems.

articles.title: How OpenAI's red team made ChatGPT agent into an AI fortress

articles.summary: Discover OpenAI's red team blueprint: How 110 coordinated attacks and 7 exploit fixes created ChatGPT Agent's revolutionary 95% security defense system. Read more here: OpenAI’s Red Team Bloc: How they created Chat GPT Agent.

articles.title: Sarnia police launch new AI-powered homelessness hotline
articles.author: CBC
articles.summary: The City of Sarnia and the Police Service have launched a new hotline to deal with calls related to homelessness. The hotline is answered by an AI attendant and it's available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. It's available to anyone who needs help with homelessness.

articles.title: Artificial Streaming, Not AI, Is The Threat to Music Industry
articles.author: Billboard
articles.summary: Artificial streaming is not the immediate concern for the company. It's not about AI. It is about the technology. It means it's about the content. It doesn't have to be about artificial intelligence. It can be about anything else at all.

articles.author: Tech Radar
articles.summary: In a world where AI can fabricate entire vacation spots, travelers need a new level of digital street smarts to avoid booking trips to places that don't even exist.       .   in the world of AI, travelers now need to be more aware of their surroundings.

articles.summary: In Special Ops 2, Kay Kay Kay Menon returns as RAW officer Himmat Singh. The story takes a thrilling turn as the battle moves from the field to the digital world. Watch this review by Tavishi to know if it lives up to the hype.

articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Juhi Parmar drives her daughter to school during traffic jams. They talk about school, friendships, and artificial intelligence. Juhi believes that being future-ready is about learning how to think, solve, and create and a good PC can be a big part of that journey.

articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: OpenAI has unveiled a new tool called "ChatGPT Agent" which allows users to perform complex, multi-step tasks via a fully virtual computer operated by the tool on their behalf. This represents a qualitative leap forward in the world of artificial intelligence agents.

articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Perplexity AI, backed by Nvidia, is in talks with mobile makers to pre-install its AI-powered Comet browser, aiming to compete with Google's and Facebook's Chrome browser.    Perplexum AI is in discussions with mobile manufacturers to pre install its browser.

articles.author: The Irish Times
articles.summary: Apple needs a product-focused CEO, not one centred on logistics, according to New York-based LightShed Partners. Apple's AI problems mean some analysts think it might be time for Tim Cook to go.       iReport.com

articles.summary: Sameer Samat, Google's head of Android, told aspiring engineers that a computer science degree alone isn't enough to land a job at a top tech company. Candidates need to develop deep expertise in areas they're genuinely passionate about beyond their formal education.

articles.author: The Hill
articles.summary: The Trump administration allowed Nvidia to sell AI chips to China again. Rep. John Moolenaar (R-Mich.) is the chair of the House Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Party. He wrote a letter to Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick about the H20 chip.

articles.summary: The new Mercedes-Benz CLA has been road-testing in Denmark. It answers questions and can have 'complex conversations' with the car thanks to the addition of AI. It's being offered for the first time and is available for pre-order now.

articles.summary: Instead of using AI for productivity or content, I asked it timeless philosophical questions to explore whether it could sharpen how we think. It answered that it could. I asked if AI could be used to sharpen our thinking. It could be useful for that.

articles.title: Why governance matters more than ever
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: The Philippines has climbed nine spots to rank 56th in the 2024 Government AI Readiness Index, reflecting improvements in investments, infrastructure, and policies. Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming how we work, connect with customers, and manage businesses in the Philippines.

articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: AI crushes coding legends, but human still wins the race against OpenAIs. The AI is better than human but still not better than the other one, though. The winner is the one who has the most code knowledge.   Â

articles.summary: The proliferation of AI tech has many callers suspecting that they should talk to a representative instead of their customers. Callers are angry at them for problems beyond their control and they are accused of not being human.       .

articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Home Credit Philippines is at the forefront of using artificial intelligence to drive innovation. With AI, the organization improves customer experience and boosts operational efficiency in its collections management process. Home Credit's journey with AI in collections began during the early 2000s.

articles.summary: PLDT Inc. and Smart Communications Inc. have launched the AI & Innovation Skilling Program. It's a multi-level training initiative aimed at equipping employees across all ranks with practical artificial intelligence skills to help them adapt to evolving digital demands. In the latest phase of the program, 44 senior IT professionals were trained.
